medical_history.chief_complaint: Cough, progressive shortness of breath, subjective fevers, malaise, and new swelling in both legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 weeks prior to admission, progressively worsening. The patient reported inability to walk farther than one city block without stopping to rest. Arthralgias in hands and knees began 3 months before admission, worse in the morning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Migraine headaches since age 10, subclinical herpes simplex virus type 2 infection, uncomplicated delivery of a healthy baby 3 years ago.
medical_history.family_history: A sister in El Salvador has kidney disease of uncertain cause.
medical_history.social_history: Originally from El Salvador, immigrated to the United States 5 years prior. Works in food services, does not smoke or use illicit drugs, and rarely consumes alcohol.
